Fields.DialogueText: Voykov! Can you please do me a favor?
What? You think because I'm your friend that I automatically do favors for you?
That's... That's not what I was thinking at all. I just have a task for you to do because I'm your captain...

Fields.MenuText: I was just wondering if you could help the crew repaint part of the ship.
I'm a little scared to tell you now... but the crew needs help repainting part of the ship.
Nothing, nothing...

Fields.DialogueText: Da, Kapitan. Anything for this ship.
Don't be scared to tell me anything. You know I have strong loyalties to this ship.
Please tell me. I'm sorry I can be a little... scary, but I will do whatever it takes to keep the ship in tip-top shape!
Wow... For the ship, but not for your dear, old friend the Captain?
You're just trying to make me feel guilty. We could've been such good friends, what a shame. Oh well, let's just go fight those Neizvestniy flot... separately.
Wait... Was that a joke? I can't tell when you're joking, Voykov! Voykov?!
@BATTLE
Oh... Um, what is it?
How are you doing today, Voykov? Voykov? Hello?
What? Oh, uh, sorry. I guess I was just really lost in my book...
No time for reading right now! The Morganas are here.
@BATTLE
Oh my gosh, oh my gosh. Nyet nyet nyet...
What's going on, Voykov? Are you hurt?!

Fields.MenuText: Calm down, it's just a book. Why are you going crazy over some ink and paper?
It has to be somewhere. Don't worry. I'm sure you just set it down when the fighting began.
Not your book! That's terrible... Damn it, we have to find it! You can't lose a treasure like that.

Fields.DialogueText: Really, Kapitan?! Books are such an important part of our culture! How can you not love them with every fiber of your being?
What if we can't, though? I was in the middle of such a good part...
I know! I knew I shouldn't have brought it up on deck... It's too precious.
Oh wait, is that it right there?
Da! I hope it's okay!
Oh... No "thank you"...?
I lost my book! What if it went overboard? What if one of the Neizvestniy flot took it?! They don't deserve that kind of knowledge!
*ALARM*
"Day One of my audio diary..." Nyet, nyet... "Audio Journal, Day One. All is well on the ship..." Nyet... Blin! This is not...
Voykov, what in the world are you doing?
Kapitan! You're ruining my audio diary! Stop talking!
Oh... Uh, sorry? I'm sorry.
Ah, never mind. I guess I'll just pause it for now.
Did I interrupt something important?

Fields.MenuText: We have a ship's log. What else do you need to document?
Recording all of our battles in detail?
Recording your secret thoughts and feelings?

Fields.DialogueText: Kaptian, I just have... thoughts. Things that I think about, that I can't really talk to others about.
Perhaps... but other things, too. It is not easy to explain why I feel the need to do this.
Feelings?! Nyet, I... I just... I want to remember everything that goes on here.
Easier than writing them down, I suppose. Whatever it is you're looking for, I hope you find it, Voykov.
Maybe I found something, but I don't know what to do with my feelings, Kapitan.
Not really, I guess. I just thought it would be helpful to record some... things.
Maybe talk to me about something that I am trying to understand... about myself and about...
You found a good book to read or something? Well, I don't mind if you want to talk about it to a recording, but you can talk to me about it, if you ever need to.
That offer is... very much appreciated, Kapitan. Maybe you could--
Maybe I could what?
*ALARM*
I hate to set this aside, but we need to get to the bridge.
Da, Kapitan.
@BATTLE
How in the world do you use this recording contraption? I've never seen one quite like this before.
Press that little button there to start the recording.
Like this? (click) I see some parts moving. Is it recording now?

Fields.MenuText: Being able to command an entire crew of people who have to listen to me. Final answer.
I honestly just enjoy being out on the ocean for extended periods of time. It's my favorite place to be and I'm so happy that I get to do this for a living.
I like being a leader for the people on this ship. I feel like I have some sort of purpose.

Fields.DialogueText: Command must be quite a thrill for you, Kapitan. I have served many kapitans who thought the same way.
Good answer! I enjoy living on the sea as well.
Spoken from the heart. We all need to find purpose in our lives.
So is that it?
I had a few other questions, but this is a good start, Kapitan.
Which button do I push to stop the recording?
@BATTLE
Da. Ahem. Now I will begin with a question for you. What exactly is your favorite part about being the captain of a ship?
Neizvestniy flot... Ah! Do not concern yourself, Kapitan. I will stop the machine for us. Hurry to the bridge, and I will meet you there.
No need to trouble yourself, Kapitan. I can operate the device for us.
I'm willing to learn! Besides, I enjoy having you teach me things.
You sound like you want to stop here. I can keep going if you want, Voykov.
My next question is... (looks at recorder) ... personal, but I want to know if--
*ALARM*
Voykov? Ah, maybe this is crazy, but-
That old bread from the mess you are holding? Da, Kapitan. Eating it might indeed be a sign of some mental distress.
The cooks do their best, Voykov.
Hah! (chuckles) So... what is it that you require, Kapitan?
Can you teach me how to fight?
You do not know how to do this? Ridiculous.

Fields.MenuText: I can handle myself, but some pointers from you might improve my skills.
Never thrown a punch in my life, Voykov.
If you're going to make it embarrassing, forget about it.

Fields.DialogueText: And you come to me for this help?! What can I say?
Bozhe moi! A fighter like you? You joke with me!
Nyet, nyet! I did not mean to make you uncomfortable, Kapitan.
I can help you. Forgive me if your request took me by surprise.
@BATTLE
Yet the bread is uneaten.
Fine! You got me. I was going to see if some seagulls would have better luck with it.
Sounds like we have a deal?
What do I get out of this deal?
You get to... uh... see my moves?
Ha! (blush) Start by showing me your moves against the Morganas. I'll be watching you closely!
You have some interesting moves, Kapitan.
I'm enjoying yours, too, Voykov.

Fields.MenuText: Always remain on the offensive!
Never let your guard down!
Try to anticipate your opponent's next move.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, that's very important, but not the most important.
I suppose that's necessary to do, but it's not the most important thing to me.
That's always a good tactic, but there's something that's even more important.
So what is it?
Do not care. Do not care about your enemy or yourself. You must ignore all emotions, and...
Voykov? Are you okay?
Da, Kapitan! Let's go test your fighting skills out on some Morganas!
@BATTLE
Ha! I did not say I was enjoying it!
And?
Emotions and feelings... Mistakes... Such a big risk...
Now that we'll all sweaty... what do you think?
A question for you. Do you know what the most important part of fighting is?
Voykov, I need to talk to you about a rather... serious matter.
I would never dream about having anything other than a serious conversation with you. What is it?
I'm extremely concerned about you. I knew there was something slightly off about you, but... that battle we fought together really showed me another side of you.
I'm not sure I know exactly what you're referring to.
I can't stop thinking about how you told me to just get rid of all my emotions and not care about anything.

Fields.MenuText: I always fight with 100% of my ability, but I can't bring myself to not care.
I don't think I can turn off my emotions like that. I hate hurting things, even if it's the Morganas.
I suppose I can be a little ruthless, but there's a difference between that and simply becoming... Inhuman.

Fields.DialogueText: That's the only way I can fight. So what if it leaks into my day to day life?
I am not a monster...
Inhuman? I'm not inhuman! Nowhere near it! I can't believe you would accuse me of such a thing.
Maybe this is hitting a nerve. I didn't mean to upset you, Voykov. I'm sorry about that.
Spasibo... I guess.
I've offended you.
Nyet. Nyet, Kapitan. I took no offense, and it does not affect my combat readiness.
@BATTLE
That's just how I fight. It has brought me this far.
If you say so.
*ALARM*
Kapitan! I've been trying.
Trying what? What in the world are you talking about?

Fields.MenuText: I'm very sorry about that... I don't know what came over me.
I was just being honest! I'm not going to sugarcoat things for you.
Maybe I could have phrased it a bit better, but it needed to be said. It was very worrying.

Fields.DialogueText: Nyet, you were absolutely right. I want to thank you for bringing it to my attention.
Understood. Tough love is the only way to really drive something into someone's head.
I'm sorry that I ever worried you, I didn't mean to. Thank you for being harsh, though. I really needed that.
So have you made any improvements so far?
Absolutely! You look very aesthetically pleasing in that outfit.
Uh... I suppose that's a slight improvement. The awkwardness will wear off eventually. Shall we test it out on those Morganas over there?
Da, Kapitan.
@BATTLE
Not being cold and unfeeling! Like you said I was...
All hands, battle stations! This is not a drill!
@BATTLE
Voykov, what was that?!
What do you mean, Captain?
Your fighting seemed sloppy at best! The results were acceptable, but... it felt strange. What's happening to you?

Fields.MenuText: Forget it, forget this whole thing. I want the old Voykov back. This is not working out at all.
Do you really think you can stick to it? I'd really like it if you could try to show a little more emotion.
Improve? It didn't feel like improvement. Or progress towards improvement. I didn't like what I saw.

Fields.DialogueText: Really? Are you being completely honest? ... I'm so relieved. This has been so difficult.
Honestly? I don't think I can do it. This really isn't working out for me, Kapitan.
I'm actually relieved to hear you say that. I've been looking for an excuse to go back to my old self.
So I have my ruthless Voykov back?
Ruthless. I suppose so.
I've really missed her.
I've missed her too.
I'm not going to lie... This new fighting style is taking some getting used to. I think I'm almost there, though. I just want to improve my contributions to this ship!
Audio Journal, Day--
Voykov!
Oomph! Curious timing for another interruption, Kapitan.
You're needed in the bridge. The Morganas are back!
@BATTLE
Can't I just get a little peace around here for once? Not just silence while I am recording, but some privacy as well.
Another big secret recording, huh? You've had a lot on your mind lately, Voykov.

Fields.MenuText: You can say that again!
It's me, isn't it? We're getting closer, and it's causing some problems.
Whatever it is, you've got a lot bubbling beneath the surface. A lot of tension.

Fields.DialogueText: I cannot answer that.
For a Belle whom some people consider cold-blooded, it is ironic to be told I am moody.
We've obviously got some feelings between us. Maybe that's making your job more difficult.
You are not part of my problems, I promise. I struggle with something else. Perhaps that is a fight I am unprepared for.
I'll give you privacy, Voykov - but approach me if you ever think I can help. I want to help you.
Things I could not expect you to understand, Kapitan.
Spasibo, Kapitan. I appreciate you doing that for me.
Kapitan? Where are you?
On the bridge where you should be. Detected some Morganas and they're closing range.
@BATTLE
I've survived worse fights than that. Everybody good? How about you, Voykov?
Your spirits seem unaffected, Kapitan.
No worse for the wear. How about you? Everything holding together?

Fields.MenuText: What's troubling you?
Something on your mind?
After that battle, your hands look steady as ever, Voykov.

Fields.DialogueText: I am not troubled...
Hardly anything interesting to ask me about or talk about, is there?
Why wouldn't they be?
I tried to express myself with more emotion, fight with more emotion, and yet...
You don't need to defend yourself. You're not under attack here, Voykov...
I'm leaving now. There's only so much of this I can handle...
I am still here.
Think me cold if you wish, Kapitan. I may not squeal at every salvo or jump with every splash, but I am not unfeeling.
"Recording Number Thirty Seven. I, First Comrade Voykov, have married the Kapitan. Everything was fine, until we disagreed upon what to name--"

Fields.MenuText: (clicks recorder back on) "I love my kapitan's wonderful sense of humor, too."
Just trying to get a reaction out of you, Voykov.
That look on your face when I said "married" was priceless!

Fields.DialogueText: (shuts recorder off) This is expensive equipment.
Why? Because I am emotionless and cold?
What about my face? Is my face not pretty enough unless you tease me like that?
Ah...
I know that I enter battle with an icy demeanor, Kapitan, but I do have thoughts and feelings, too.
I know that.
Not everybody on this crew - or my past crews, for that matter - ever seemed to.
Maybe that's why the two of us are in your quarters, and you're letting me put my hands all over your equipment.
If you are trying to make me blush, Kapitan, think again. I will not.
Fair enough. I've got some paperwork to finish, and I should let you record your thoughts in peace.
Both of us should expect a delay in our plans, it seems.
Kapitan! (turns recorder off) That... that...
I know why you are doing this, Kapitan.
Having fun with you? Yes. Because I like you.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Hello, Voykov! Voykov? Are you doing all right?
I'm fine, I just feel a little nauseated.
Are you going to have another seizure? We could get you to lie down and relax a bit.
Kapitan, nyet! It's not that. The waves are just particularly bad today. I'm fine. Please don't panic.
You didn't tell me about it last time, so forgive me if I pry more than you'd like.
I promise I will notify you. Do not worry about that.
So why in the world didn't you tell me last time?

Fields.MenuText: That's ridiculous! Weakness, ha! You're one of the best crew members on this ship, epileptic or not.
I don't think it shows weakness, but I don't want anything to happen to you.
I'm pretty sure you would've just beaten me up if I had tried to tell you can't do something.

Fields.DialogueText: Do you really think so? Everyone has their strengths and weaknesses, ... but I'll take that compliment anyway!
I wouldn't have let anything happen to myself. You are my kapitan, but I would still go and do everything that you told me not to.
I can't say that you're wrong...
Voykov, I won't remove you from duty - if that's what you're afraid of. Who else would fight Morganas as well as you do?
@BATTLE
I just thought... I thought that you would see it as a sign of weakness and prevent me from being involved on the ship.
Heh. Few candidates leap to mind, Kapitan.
*ALARM*
"Audio Journal entry: Acquiring epilepsy was a very big mistake."
Having epilepsy isn't a choice.

Fields.MenuText: That seems a bit... ambitious. I think you should leave that to medical professionals.
Please, not on my ship. I don't want you to accidentally poison my entire crew.
We do have a bunch of supplies with us... Why not give it a shot?

Fields.DialogueText: Some "professionals" I do not trust.
It wouldn't the your entire crew. I'd just test it on a couple people.
Kapitan, I am not trained in the medical field. How could you suggest that?
I suppose when medical science has a cure, we'll know about it.
That assumption seems safe, Kapitan.
Until then, Morganas are the biggest threat to our health.
On that, we can agree.
@BATTLE
My seizures, however... they spoil things less pleasantly. Maybe I could have tried harder to cure it or something.
You pleasantly spoil so many of these recordings, Kapitan.
*ALARM*
Voykov! I need you! The Morganas are back and there's a lot of them!
I'm always ready for battle!
@BATTLE
Whoa, Voykov! What's that?!
What's what?
There's a huge gash on your arm!
Where? Oh, there! It's fine, it's not that bad.
Are you kidding me?! It's huge and it's bleeding profusely!

Fields.MenuText: Surprisingly enough, I trust you to do that. Just call if you need anything.
Absolutely not! Come with me, we're going to find someone.
Fine, but I'll be watching over your shoulder the entire time just to make sure nothing goes awry.

Fields.DialogueText: You certainly do have a high opinion of me. I really appreciate that.
Nyet! I can do this by myself. The only person I trust is myself.
I refuse.
The next time you see me, I'll be in tip-top shape!
Hope you're sure about that...
I will take care of it myself.
Kapitan! Neizvestniy flot on the horizon!
Point them out. I don't see anything, yet.
Right there! On the horizon. How can you not see them?
I... What? Maybe? I see some specks. Is that them?
Da, isn't it obvious? To my eyes it is. We need to prepare for battle!
@BATTLE
Voykov, how were you able to see those Morganas from so far away?!

Fields.MenuText: I certainly can't. I have terrible vision!
I mean, I thought my vision was pretty good - but obviously it could be far better!
Belles have freakishly good senses.

Fields.DialogueText: I never stopped to think that other people might not see like this... That must be terrible! How do you live?
True... You couldn't even see those Neizvestniy flot...
Or maybe you're the freak of nature and I am normal. How does that feel?
How good are you at seeing at night?
I can see at night just as well as I can during the day.
How would you feel about becoming our main lookout at night? The rest of the crew certainly cannot compare!
I would never refuse your order, or a task in which I could assist my crew. Ah, and we would have to cancel some of our social time together, Kapitan.
Can't everyone see like that?
On second thought...
Voykov! Having fun out here?
I am, indeed. Assisting the lookouts and enjoying the fresh air has been pleasurable, Kapitan.
I'm sure those junior sailors appreciated your personal guidance.
I am comfortable mentoring them, if that is what you mean. For instance, if you were in my care...
Spasibo, Kapitan. I would teach you as a lookout to raise your binoculars and scan more carefully.
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: I think "check on me" is the phrase you meant.
I was worried you were burning down my ship. You and your crazy shenanigans.
Your flirting is getting better, Voykov.

Fields.DialogueText: Check on me. Check me out. What is the difference? Same words to me.
Not your best joke, but I appreciate your attention.
Oh. That is a good thing, I hope?
Just saying hello. Get back to work, Voykov.
Kapitan, why originally did you desire to check me out?
I like the sound of this so far.
Tut-tut-tut. Pay attention instead of flirting with me during my lesson, Kapitan.
(grins) Oh, do continue, First Comrade!
And what would I see if I were to... Oh! Spotted 'em, Voykov.
Ah, you see them now! A pack of Neizvestniy flot scum-heads quickly moving towards us!
Aye aye, Kapitan.
Audio Journal Entry. I have experienced some difficulty sleeping. I am often drows... drowsss... drowzzz...
Hey, Voykov, shut that recorder off and get some sleep.
Zzzz... Huh?! I am not faaa.... Zzzz...
Voykov, you're falling asleep as we speak!
Zzzz... I believe in Trotsky... Zzzz...
I knew it! (shuts off recorder)

Fields.MenuText: I don't want to make it an order, Voykov.
Falling asleep while recording a journal about not getting enough sleep? C'mon, Voykov.
I care about you, Voykov. I want you to be rested.

Fields.DialogueText: Nyet! I'll go to sleep, I'll go to sleep!
I don't need more sleep. I may, however, require better sleep.
Your concern is acknowledged, Kapitan.
Finish my coffee. Then after this fight, lights out for you!
@BATTLE
Hm? Sleep is for stupid people...
*ALARM*
Zzzzz... zzz...
Aye aye, Kapitan.
Hello, Voykov. I need something from you.
What is it, Kapitan?
The crew belowdecks need some help moving some of the heavier crates. Would you be able to help them?
Absolutely. I'll be there right away.
I really appreciate it! ... Voykov? What's that?

Fields.MenuText: That... That full bottle of acid. I thought it was empty the last time I had checked. Why is it full now?
There's a full bottle of acid there that was once empty... You know what, you don't have to tell me. I don't want to know what kind of nefarious thing you're up to...
I'm going to assume that the once-empty, now-full bottle of acid on that table is decorative - not at all for any sort of malicious activities.

Fields.DialogueText: What full bottle of acid? ... I don't know what you're talking about.
You automatically assume I'm up to something nefarious? ... I'm flattered.
I thought you knew me, Kapitan. Why would you assume that?
Morganas... Don't think this conversation is over, though!
@BATTLE
I don't know what you're referring to, sir.
*ALARM*
It could simply be a bottle of water for me to drink, Kapitan. Or perhaps vodka.
Voykov...
Your curiosity is interesting, Kapitan. I will presume that your close scrutiny is a manifestation of our emotional bond.
*ALARM*
It's such a beautiful day, isn't it, Voykov? Voykov? Are you crying?
Nyet. Crying is for sissies!

Fields.MenuText: Wow, not even when you were a baby?
So you aren't crying. You were playing with that bottle of acid and got some in your eyes. To sickbay with you!
It's very clear that you're crying, now please tell me what's wrong.

Fields.DialogueText: I was not ever a baby. If that is all, I would like to be alone.
That theory is also wrong, Kapitan. Please drop the matter.
There's nothing wrong because I'm not crying.
I'll respect the request, even though we both know that you're upset about something.
I'm not scary! I am not. I'm the friendliest they come. Why do people avoid me?
I don't avoid you.
My demeanor and my behavior have driven people away. That truth - I have lived with it for years, but for a moment it came breaking through.
Let's go, Voykov. C'mon.
@BATTLE
I've never cried once in my life!
*ALARM*
It will pass, Kapitan.
Kapitan, can I ask you a personal question?
Depends on what it is.

Fields.MenuText: I think that everyone has a permanent soul no matter what. There are ways to strengthen it, though, like kind deeds and such.
It would probably have to be something like devoting your life to a certain cause. By believing in something so much and doing everything in your power to help it, you can regain your soul.
My guess would be that you have to do some enormous act of kindness and sacrifice. You have to do something unselfish and purely out of the goodness of your heart in order to get your soul back.

Fields.DialogueText: You really don't think that if a person has been truly terrible they can lose their soul? Or maybe even just pieces of it?
Do you think it could be anything? You just have to give your life meaning of some sort?
It would be really hard to come up with something like that...
You know as well as I do that I'm no god, though. I can't give you a real answer.
Oh, I know. It was just a hypothetical question anyway. People don't even have souls.
Are you sure? Because it really seems like you believe that...
Kapitan, the Morganas are back. Let's go beat them senseless.
@BATTLE
Well, I know we've talked about this before, but... I know your stance on people having souls or not.
I don't really believe they do, but hypothetically, how do you think someone can get it back once they've lost it?
*ALARM*
Audio Diary Entry. I have matters of philosophy which I will discuss.
I used to fall asleep to lectures like this in school... but maybe you can make it more stimulating, Voykov.

Fields.MenuText: Absolutely. Souls exist.
I don't believe in souls, but I do believe we have a conscience.
An empty black hole of nothingness. We're animals learning to get along with other animals, I'm afraid.

Fields.DialogueText: You're entitled to your opinion, but you're wrong.
Actually, da! That is exactly what I am thinking of.
A bold statement! Why have we not discussed more philosophy, Kapitan? I would enjoy it.
In the place of the soul there is humanity and morality. There's a sort of ''compass'' inside everyone that tells you what to do and guides you. Not a magical soul, however.
Quite nice, Voykov. You're easy to listen to.
Spasibo. Compliments like that are easy for *me* to listen to.
Want to hear something even better? Morganas are coming.
@BATTLE
My recording is not for you... but I welcome your interruption all the same.
Do you believe in souls? If there is no such thing, what is in its place?
Then we go to our stations, Kapitan.
Voykov? Are you busy?
Not that busy. Is there something you need?
Not really. I just wanted to let you know that I'm really glad you're on this ship.

Fields.MenuText: I was just trying to have a moment with you... What is all this about?
Failed?!
Not from where I'm standing. I like it when you get all... severe.

Fields.DialogueText: But you still failed!
Da! Failed!
And from where I am standing, you failed!
You failed to interrupt my audio diary recording!
@BATTLE
Your plan has failed, Kapitan! Failed!
Is THAT what you were talking about? Ha! You had me going for a minute!
That is all, Kapitan. I'm actually glad you stopped by. Maybe... you could stay a little longer? I'm not recording, so we could just enjoy each other's company...
*ALARM*
Hmph!
Ah, the air is sweet today. Nice seeing you out here, Kapitan.
You're in a mood today, aren't you?
A good one. Da.
Glad to see that.
I enjoy this feeling.
Emotions and feelings aren't so bad, are they?

Fields.MenuText: You keep your thoughts and feelings locked up pretty tight, but they aren't all bad.
Good emotions are best when shared.
Maybe you can learn to loosed up a little.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh.
I seldom share any of mine, but I see your point.
I think I am learning exactly that, Kapitain.
You've come a long way.
@BATTLE
What do you mean by that?
I understand you are not talking about the kilometers we have traveled on this harrowing war patrol.
*ALARM*
Right. I mean, as a person. You've come a long way. It...
It appears I am not the only one with feelings, Kapitan. Or some difficulty expressing them.
Come a little bit closer. I will express them for you. *kiss*
Thanks, Voykov.
Time to openly express our feelings for the Morganas.
I will give them a less-tender kiss. From all of my guns.
I must hand something to you, Kapitan...
What are you handing to me? Haha...
I was trying to tell you how much respect I have for you. Do you not like my compliments?
Lighten up a little bit, Voykov! You're not going to enjoy life if you don't laugh sometimes.

Fields.MenuText: You "think?!" I'm so offended, Voykov! After all we've been through...
I feel the same.
You're breaking up with me? We just started dating!

Fields.DialogueText: There you go with the jokes again! I'm trying to be extremely serious here.
Good. That makes my heart feel... right.
I know you're being sarcastic, but I like this about you. Even though the amount of jokes you make is to much.
What else do we really need to say? We care about each other, and that bond is a strong one.
Spasibo, Kapitan.
I'm ready if you are.
@BATTLE
I enjoy life just fine! My life, always jumping from place to place... But now, being with you... I do not think I want that time to ever end.
So...
So...
Are you ready to leap into battle again? The Neizvestniy flot will be here any minute.
Then a kiss for luck and we cannot lose! *kiss*
